entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who wrote a letter and convinced some people of his story.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as excitedly reading a letter that Harry has convinced someone with.

entities.name: fr ed
entities.description: Fred is mentioned as joining in the letter-opening and expressing his opinion about one of the letters.

entities.name: paisley
entities.description: Paisley is mentioned as the location where a witch wrote a long letter to Harry.

entities.name: you-know-who
entities.description: You-Know-Who is mentioned as the one that some people don't want to believe has come back.

relationships.description: Harry received a letter from Paisley, as mentioned in the text: 'a long letter from a witch in Paisley'.
Some people believe that You-Know-Who has come back, as mentioned in the text: 'he really doesn’t want to believe You-Know-Who’s back'.
Hermione is excitedly reading a letter that Harry has convinced someone with, as mentioned in the text: 'Here’s another one you’ve conv inced, Harry!'
Fred expressed his opinion about one of the letters, as mentioned in the text: 'Blimey, what a waste of parchment . . .’
